The Mirror understands that Tottenham are only willing to pay Mbeumo £130,000 per week if he was to move to north London.
This figure is thought to be less than the £150,000-200,000 per week that United can reportedly afford to offer the Cameroonian and this could help sway the deal in the Reds' favour.
Journalist Pete O'Rourke has told Football Insider, that Gyokeres is considered to be United's top target in the summer transfer window in terms of a centre-forward purchase.
It is understood that the deal will mainly come down to finances with Gyokeres and a fee with Sporting.

Sporting are believed to have quoted United £85m for Gyokeres which is his current release clause in Lisbon. There is also slight question marks as to whether the Swede will be happy without Champions League football next season.
According to reports in Lisbon, relayed by The Mirror, Gyokeres is thought to be ready to go on strike to try and earn a move away from Sporting.
Gyokeres' camp continue to suggest that they hold a gentleman's agreement to allow their striker to leave for less than his £85m release clause.
Sporting meanwhile are adamant that no such agreement exists and that they expect to receive his full release clause before allowing him to depart.
Viktor Gyokeres stirred the pot further surrounding his potential exit from Sporting this summer.
Posting on his Instagram story on Thursday, the striker explained:
There is a lot of talk at the moment, most of it is false. I will speak when the time is right.
The post came amid claims that Sporting have raised their asking price for Gyokeres to £68m this summer.
United signing Hugo Ekitike ahead of Chelsea and Liverpool this summer transfer window would move Ruben Amorim closer to having a completely new-look front line next season.

Matheus Cunha, after completing a transfer from Wolverhampton Wanderers on Thursday, confirmed the first step of that overhaul. United director of football Jason Wilcox describes the Brazil international as "one of the most exciting and productive forwards in England".
He "proved his ability to succeed in the Premier League" at Wolves, notably at Old Trafford in April. However, he is not a centre-forward, playing best as a second striker behind a focal point.
MORE HERE.
MEN Sport understands that Mbeumo is still giving priority to United ahead of fresh negotiations next week when the transfer window reopens.

The forward has been United's top priority since missing out on Delap and they have received reassurances that the player wants to move to Old Trafford despite the lack of Champions League football next season.
On Thursday, Tottenham confirmed that Thomas Frank would be their new manager replacing Ange Postecoglou in north London.

It is claimed that now his former manager is at Spurs, Mbeumo is more inclined to accept an offer from the club and the Europa League holders have launched an initial enquiry as to the costs associated with the deal.
Unfortunately for United, if they were thinking they would be able to sign Hugo Ekitike on the cheap they would be very much mistaken.
Eintracht Frankfurt's CEO Markus Krosche has insisted that they will demand £85m from United before agreeing to him leaving the club.
If the price isn't right, then he'll just stay with us. We don't have to sell Hugo.
Welcome back to the United transfer blog this Friday afternoon.
My name is Jack Flintham and I shall be taking over from Matt this lunchtime up until 5pm as we bring you all the updates on the Reds' transfer business.
We are going to kick things off by discussing the latest surrounding the potential purchase of this man...
Manchester United will reportedly have the opportunity to sign Dusan Vlahovic this summer.

GiveMeSport claims the Juventus striker is keen to play in the Premier League, with United said to be in the player's sights. Intermediaries and his representatives are seeking a move for the player deemed surplus to Turin's requirements.
United could reportedly extend the contract of Jadon Sancho this summer if they have to settle for loaning the player out again.

Football Insider claims they could trigger an extension to include an obligation to buy in any loan deal for the winger. Sancho's contract expires next summer, so no club would agree to such an arrangement when they could agree a free transfer instead.
Emiliano Martinez is reportedly 'waiting for Manchester United' despite receiving an offer from Galatasaray.

BOLAVIP claims the Turkish club have contacted Aston Villa and opened talks for the goalkeeper to become their new number one, replacing the departing Fernando Muslera. Martinez is said to want Champions League football next season, which Galatasaray offers as league champions, but the Argentina international also seemingly wants to stay in the Premier League.
United are allegedly his main option; however, the club are reputedly holding off as they have yet to sell Andre Onana. Villa are said to value Martinez at £30-40million.
Alan Shearer believes United signing Viktor Gyokeres would not be a surprise because of the Ruben Amorim factor.
Speaking to Betfair, he said:
On Viktor Gyokeres, I’m not surprised at all if they get him because of his work with Sporting and Ruben Amorim before, I think that was always going to be the case.

They’re not in Europe this year, they’re not in the Champions League and they’re going to have to pay huge wages to get the players and tempt them away from other clubs that are going to be interested in them.”
Rio Ferdinand would prefer United to sign Victor Osimhen over Viktor Gyokeres this summer.
Ferdinand told the Mirror:
I think Gyokeres, everyone's talking about him. Again, I think if I'm looking at the market now and I had to pick him or Osimhen, I'd probably pick Osimhen because of that experience.
And he's shown he's done it in multiple leagues now. And he's done it internationally as well. I think he's a top-class number nine who, again, the young players will be able to learn from.
I'm not saying that Gyokeres would fail. I'm just saying that if I had a preference, I would go there.
More from Ferdinand: United told to snub Viktor Gyokeres in favour of 'obvious' signing

Cunha will add goals and athleticism to United's attack, meaning he ticks a variety of boxes for head coach Ruben Amorim. Despite strengthening their attacking pool with the addition of the former Atletico Madrid forward, United do not want their attacking additions to stop there, with Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo next on their hit list.

In addition to wanting Mbeumo, United remain hungry to sign a striker this summer. Liam Delap was United's top target to bolster their No.9 options, but they were beaten to his signature by Chelsea, meaning they are now looking elsewhere for a goal-getter.

They have been linked with a collection of strikers in recent weeks, including Sporting Lisbon star Viktor Gyokeres and Victor Osimhen of Napoli. Gyokeres is keen to leave Sporting and Napoli want to sell Osimhen.
More: United have decided on their next four signings after sealing Cunha transfer
United are reportedly monitoring the potential availability of Douglas Luiz.

GiveMeSport claims Juventus are open to selling the midfielder for a cut-price fee this summer and take a loss on the £42million they paid Aston Villa last year. It is said offers as low as £30million could be enough to get a deal done.
Leeds United, Nottingham Forest and Villa are also reputedly in the race for the Brazil international. Tottenham Hotspur, though, are purportedly not.
United are preparing to announce the signing of Enzo Kana-Biyik on a free transfer.

The club are expected to formally announce the arrival of Kana-Biyik from Le Havre, unlike the signing of Harley Emsden-James - who has just turned 16 - from Southampton. Ineos-owned FC Lausanne-Sport have been linked with an immediate loan move, but it is understood that no loan plan has been confirmed.
Read more about Kana-Biyik: United set to announce signing of French striker on free transfer
United are reportedly ready to make an official offer for Viktor Gyokeres.

Maisfutebol claims that their bid would be worth £60million in total, with around £51million guaranteed and another £9million in add-ons. That, though, is said to be less than Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas wants.
United have also allegedly 'encountered obstacles' during their negotiations with Gyokeres. The striker is still reputedly on their radar, though.
Victor Osimhen remains a real option for the Reds, according to claims by United in Focus.
“We’ve known about United and Osimhen for months, and it is genuine interest," claims reporter Graeme Bailey.
United have known his wage demands and that he is prioritising a move to England for months; he has always wanted a Premier League move.

“I understand after talking with a source close to the player that we can confirm Osimhen is not basing his decision on money, if he were, he would have accepted the Saudi offer. He does, however, believe he is one of the best strikers in world football and wants to be paid as such, which doesn’t mean he will be demanding Saudi money from United.
“He knows United are an option and he wants to come to England. Chelsea is not an option; however, I am told not to rule out Liverpool.

“While not being concerned about Champions League football, he is not going to want to come and never play Champions League. United will have sold him the project with Bruno Fernandes staying, Cunha and Mbeumo joining.”
Manchester United-linked Viktor Gyokeres has broken his silence on social media as speculation surrounding his future at Sporting intensifies.
Read what he had to say here
Tottenham Hotspur have confirmed that former Reds coach Andreas Georgson has joined Thomas Frank's new backroom staff at Spurs.
Georgson, who left United this year, is a set-piece coach who has worked with Frank previously before moving on to Arsenal and then the Reds.
Manchester United have officially announced the signing of Matheus Cunha from Wolves on Thursday afternoon.
Reacting to his move, Cunha said: “It is hard to put into words my feelings about becoming a Manchester United player.

"Ever since I was a child in Brazil watching Premier League games on TV at my grandmother’s house, United was my favourite English team and I dreamed of wearing the red shirt. I want to thank my family and everyone who has helped me make that dream a reality.

“I can’t wait for the start of pre-season to get to know my teammates and prepare for the season ahead. All my focus is now on working hard to become a valuable part of the team, and helping get this club back to the top.”
Arsenal have reportedly made a formal offer for Manchester United-linked Viktor Gyokeres.

The Swedish international has risen to prominence as one of Europe's leading strikers in recent years, boasting an impressive tally of 97 goals in 102 matches since his move from Coventry City to Liga Portugal in July 2023.

Sporting's top goal scorer this season has made a significant impact in the Portuguese top-tier, netting 39 goals and providing eight assists in 33 appearances. The 27-year-old has been a pivotal player in Rui Borges' squad, driving Sporting to another league title and cup victory.
Read more here

headline: RAILSTON: South America scouting and signing wonderkids - Manchester United's new transfer strategy
body: There are some ongoing changes at Manchester United that most fans won't notice.
The revised transfer strategy of signing talented youngsters falls into that category. United have always signed young players to add to their academy, but the profile of targets has evolved.

Sekou Kone (19) was signed from Mali, Diego Leon (18) has been scouted from Paraguay, while Enzo Kana-Biyik (18) is set to arrive on a free transfer from the renowned academy of French club Le Havre AC.
Ayden Heaven, Chido Obi, James Overy, Samuel Lusale and Harley Emsden-James have also been lured to Manchester with the promise of a pathway to first-team football at Old Trafford.
Heaven and Obi have already broken into the senior squad. Ruben Amorim gave opportunities to both players last season and they will be used as a shining example to future targets.

United's transfer strategy has become interesting, although it could be argued they are simply catching up with the times. Premier League rivals have cast their nets around the globe to sign young players with high ceilings, some of whom will never make a first-team appearance in England.
Profit and Sustainability Rules (PSR) have been a huge factor and some Premier League clubs are buying young players with the intention of making a profit on their sale in a few years' time.
In the summer of 2023, Chelsea signed Angelo Gabriel from Santos for £13million. They immediately sent him on loan and sold him to a Saudi Arabian club for £19.4m the following summer.
Around a similar time, Newcastle signed Yankuba Minteh from OB for £5.9m. Minteh joined Feyenoord on loan and was flipped to Brighton for £30m in the following summer.
Angelo and Minteh didn't make an appearance for Chelsea and Newcastle. Such transfers have become common to work within PSR rules, despite being against the essence of football.
United sources would deny that young players are being signed to be 'flipped', but the reality is that not every signing will make the grade and some will be sold for profit down the line.
Club sources stress that each young signing in the last 18 months has been made because they have first-team potential, however, that does not guarantee they will make a senior debut.
The transfers are essentially low risk and high reward. For example, United signed Kone for around £1m for Guidars FC and the young midfielder arrived in Manchester with a huge upside.

The best-case scenario is that Kone breaks into the first-team and establishes himself in the Premier League. The worst-case scenario is that he is below first-team standard but is still sold for a profit.

Similar signings were made by the previous regime, but they have increased since Ineos gained control of football operations. Jason Wilcox is hugely influential behind the scenes and different sources indicated he was already doing the director of football job before he was officially given the title.

The club's network of scouts present reports on young players and Kone was first scouted by United in November 2023 at the Under-17 World Cup in Indonesia. Multiple staff members from United watched Kone throughout that tournament as Mali beat Argentina to claim a third-place finish.
After following Kone at the U17 World Cup, another United scout attended an Under-18 tournament in Morocco in April 2024 where he featured as one of the players of the tournament.
It's understood the recommendation to sign Kone came after this tournament and there was communication between the club's scouting team in order to make the deal happen.
Deals to sign Obi, Overy and Lusale were also arranged last summer. United became aware that Obi wanted to leave Arsenal and was about to join a European club after visiting their training ground.
Nick Cox (head of the academy), Luke Fedderenko (head of academy recruitment), Stephen Ajewole (lead scout) and Sam Williams (lead scout) all played a huge role in signing Obi from Arsenal.
Overy (18) attracted interest from other Premier League clubs but he signed for United, while Lusale (17) was signed from Crystal Palace, and they both went into the U18 squad.

The signing of Emsden-James, 16, from Southampton this summer is similar to those deals. The centre-back will join up with the U18s in 2024/2025 and still has a long way to progress to make a first-team debut.
It will be fascinating to see how United handle Kone, Leon and Kana-Biyik ahead of 2025/2026.
Kone could leave on loan after being given time to find his feet in England, but Leon might be kept within the building so he can adapt to his new surroundings after leaving South America.
Leon completed a medical to finalise his move from Paraguay side Cerro Porteno in early January and the defender signed a five-year contract, with the option of an additional year.
It's understood United agreed a £3.3m fee, rising to £7m with add-ons, with Cerro Porteno and Leon continued to play in Paraguay with a view to moving to Manchester this summer.

United are expected to formally announce the arrivals of Leon and Kana-Biyik. The latter is joining from Le Havre on a free transfer and only a few regulatory steps remain for him to complete his move.
The highly-regarded Kana-Biyik is a natural striker and he scored nine goals in 16 appearances for the French club's Under-19s last season, while also training with their first-team.
Kana-Biyik has been linked with an immediate loan move to Ineos-owned FC Lausanne-Sport, but it's understood that no loan plan has been confirmed for the incoming French youngster.
In February, United appointed Christopher Vivell as director of recruitment on a full-time basis following his interim spell in the role and he became a regular attendee of academy games.

The role of Matt Hargreaves as director of football negotiations should also be noted. Hargreaves has a large responsibility for transfers and contracts at Old Trafford, and is known to be an excellent operator.
Representatives have spoken glowingly about Hargreaves and have praised his understanding of players, the football business and negotiations, so he is seen as a valuable member of staff.
Hargreaves does exactly what his job title says on the tin and will continue to try to obtain value during negotiations this summer, wherever that may be found across the world.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres agent reveals 'agreement' truth as Man United get new transfer update
body: Hasan Cetinkaya, the agent of Viktor Gyokeres, says he has written proof that Sporting CP promised the striker he could leave for £59million this summer.

Gyokeres, 27, has been linked with a blockbuster move to Manchester United after scoring 54 goals in 52 matches for the Portuguese side in 2024/25. United are intent on signing a new centre-forward this summer to boost Ruben Amorim's options in attack.

It had been reported that the Swede has a 'gentlemen's agreement' in place to leave Sporting for £59m, after he rejected transfer interest last summer. Gyokeres has an £85m release clause but the Portuguese club were said to have agreed for him to depart for much less.
However, Sporting president Frederico Varandas revealed in a press conference on Wednesday that there is no agreement for Gyokeres to leave for £59m in the summer transfer window.

"I can guarantee that Viktor Gyokeres will not leave for 60m euros plus 10m euros because I never promised that," Varandas said. "To this day Sporting has not had an offer for Gyokeres - neither today nor last season."

Reports in Portugal suggested that Gyokeres was left feeling 'disrespected' about the situation and won't return to Sporting for pre-season. It was added that the former Coventry City man would 'rather go on strike' and is willing to 'interrupt his vacation' to speak out about his situation and Sporting's agreement that was in place.

Gyokeres then took to social media to issue an update, as speculation continues to rise on his future. In a story on Instagram, he said: "There's a lot of talk at the moment, most of it is false. I will speak when the time is right."

Now, Gyokeres' agent, Cetinkaya, has become the latest to speak out about the situation. According to Swedish newspaper Aftonbladet, the businessman stated he has proof of the alleged agreement that he made with Sporting, and Gyokeres can, in fact, leave the club for £59m this summer.

Cetinkaya's comments are the complete contrast to what Vandaras said. "Sporting will not demand the release clause, but they should know me better by now: threats, blackmail, insults, they don't work with me," Vandaras added, as he fumed about the reported gentleman's agreement.

"I can guarantee one thing: Viktor Gyokeres will not leave for €60m + €10m. He won't leave because I never allowed it, and with this game that the agent is playing, the situation will only get worse," he assured.

While there doesn't seem to be an agreement between Gyokeres, his camp and Sporting, a departure from the Primeira Liga is all-but certain, at this stage. United remain linked, while Arsenal, Chelsea, Barcelona and Juventus are among his other potential suitors.

headline: Man United accidentally signed a player perfect for Ruben Amorim - but now they have to sell him
body: “I occasionally drop down to midfield. I don't do that for myself but to help the team. I am what I call a false striker. Not a No.9, not a No.10. I am a 9.5! That's my game."
Far from the striker Manchester United needed to sign.
Joshua Zirkzee admitted himself that he wasn't an out-and-out centre forward following his move to United, despite being brought to the club to provide cover and competition for Rasmus Hojlund.

Zirkzee's tendency to drop into pockets of space meant he was never a genuine candidate to lead United's frontline, though he became something of a cult hero for the way he bounced back from his career nadir against Newcastle, where his first-half removal was sarcastically cheered by some fans.

While his style of play didn't lend itself to leading the attack, the 3-4-2-1 system Ruben Amorim brought with him following his mid-season appointment meant Zirkzee could operate as one of the two No.10s behind the striker. He was still chosen to play as the sole centre forward at times but looked far more comfortable when operating in slightly a deeper role.
United may not have signed him to play as a No.10 but there's no doubting that's where he's looked best since his Old Trafford arrival. Though that doesn't mean he should stay at the club.

For all their issues, United have plenty of options at No.10. Matheus Cunha and Mason Mount could be joined by Bryan Mbeumo on the list of options available to Amorim behind the striker. Bruno Fernandes, Amad and Kobbie Mainoo have all played as a No.10 under Amorim, and so that's six potential options even working under the assumption they manage to offload Alejandro Garnacho, Marcus Rashford, Antony and Jadon Sancho.
Zirkzee would be ahead of some of the aforementioned players in the No.10 pecking order but it's still difficult to see where he fits in.
United didn't intend to sign a No.10 when they sanctioned a €42.5million move for Zirkzee, yet they stumbled upon a player perfect for Amorim's system.
With an abundance of options already available to them in that position, they need to cash in on the Dutchman this summer.

headline: Manchester United have £7m forgotten signing arriving next month who's been compared to Wayne Rooney
body: Manchester United have made an eye-catching start to the summer transfer window by securing the arrival of Matheus Cunha from Wolverhampton Wanderers.
The Brazilian international officially joined United earlier this week and after scoring 17 goals for Wolves last season he should add some much needed firepower to the club's ranks.
Cunha will slot into one of the attacking midfield roles in Ruben Amorim's 3-4-2-1 system and United are hopeful Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo will also arrive to play alongside him.

The Cameroon international scored 20 goals in the Premier League last season and is keen on a move to United. Tottenham and Newcastle are also said to be interested with the Bees holding out for their asking price for the 25-year-old.
But it is perhaps a summer signing that was agreed back in January that could prove to be one of the biggest steals of this window.
United announced the signing of Paraguayan left-back Diego Leon for an initial £3.3million that could rise to £7million in add-ons and he will officially join the club on July 1.
In that time, the 18-year-old has continued to play regularly for Cerro Porteno in the Paraguayan top flight, picking up invaluable experience of first team football.
There is a lot of excitement about his ceiling back in his homeland and it has perhaps gone under the radar that he will eventually make the move to Old Trafford in just 16 days' time.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.

Nobody is expecting him to match the heights of United's record goalscorer, not least because they play in different positions, but the parallels between Leon's impact on senior football at such a tender age and his look and stature with Rooney's meteoric rise at Everton are there for all to see.
Leon plays as a left-wing-back and he will, of course, have to force his way past Patrick Dorgu, Luke Shaw and Harry Amass in the pecking order.

It is more likely he will play with the under-21s to begin with but Amorim has shown he is not afraid to throw in youngsters when they are ready, handing debuts to teenagers Amass, Chido Obi, Tyler Fredricson and Ayden Heaven this season.
If Leon can deliver on his promise it will be the first success story of Ineos prioritising the signing of young players with high potential and low transfer fees.
And that prospect should excite United fans.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo breaks silence after Man United transfer 'hijacked' by Tottenham
body: Bryan Mbeumo has added fuel to the transfer fire on social media, following reports that Tottenham Hotspur want to intercept his proposed move to Manchester United. The Brentford forward is rumoured to be swayed after Spurs announced head coach Thomas Frank as Ange Postecoglou's successor on Thursday.

Earlier this summer, Mbeumo reportedly selected United as his preferred club despite competing interest from Arsenal, Newcastle United and Tottenham. However, this decision was made before Frank left Brentford for North London, and it's suggested that the Dane wants his star player to follow him.

United are still in pole position to sign the Cameroon international but have not yet made a second bid after their initial £55million offer was turned down. The bid consisted of a £45m upfront fee with £10m in add-ons.
Brentford are allegedly holding out for £60m, and whether United are willing to meet that price could be the deciding factor.
Mbeumo didn't respond to Frank's departure from the Bees on social media until Friday afternoon, amid reports of Spurs' interest, reports the Express.
The 25-year-old used his Instagram story to share Brentford's post confirming Frank's exit, captioning it with two prayer emojis.
It hasn't helped to calm the swirling speculation about his future, with United hoping Mbeumo will move to Old Trafford.
Significant developments on Mbeumo's future are expected next week after the summer transfer window re-opens until September 1 on Monday.

Frank has been open about his wish to continue working with Mbeumo. Reflecting on their successful six-year partnership at Brentford, Frank said before the window opened: "I'm the head coach. I want my best players to stay forever.
"I know that Bryan is very happy being here at Brentford, he's thriving, doing well and playing fantastic. What happens in the future? I don't know.
"I know that Bryan is very happy being here at Brentford, he's thriving, doing well and playing fantastic. What happens in the future? I don't know.
"I've said many times: we are a selling club. But at the same time, we have to reinforce that there are 10 clubs in the world that aren't selling clubs."
"So, of course, if the right price - and that's going to be expensive - is coming, then I'm sure the club will be open for it.
"But I'm very happy he's here, and I'm convinced that Bryan will still be happy playing football here."
Tottenham have reportedly earmarked Antoine Semenyo and Tyler Dibling as possible options if Mbeumo heads to United.

headline: Former Man United midfielder Paul Pogba set to end nightmare as transfer return offered
body: Ex-Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba is on the verge of a return to professional football, after almost two years without a competitive appearance. The France international was initially handed a four-year ban, reduced to 18 months upon appeal, after he was provisionally suspended following a positive drug test.

The 32-year-old mutually terminated his Juventus contract in November, and he's been free to return to the pitch since March, where he has been building up his fitness ahead of a prospective move. Pogba has faced numerous links over a free transfer including Turkey, Brazil and a move to the MLS, as well as a possible move back to France with Marseille.

However, according to fresh reports, Pogba has been offered a two-year deal at AS Monaco - which will see him return to his native France and make his bow in their national division after breaking through at Old Trafford.

Fabrizio Romano reported that negotiations and discussions on the project will continue this weekend in a bid to try to reach an agreement which would see the World Cup winner feature for Adi Hutter's side.
In an interview with Ball.LDN, Pogba pinpointed his aspirations to win one more major honour after talking up the quality of Didier Deschamps' France national team.
"The French team are exciting and I'm a big fan of them already," he said.
"I can't wait to see how they further develop and win a future World Cup - hopefully with me as a teammate."

The next edition of the grandest prize in international football will be held across three countries with Canada, Mexico and the United States hosting the competition, in 2026. The possible move to Monaco poses as an opportunity for Pogba to fire his way back into the contention of the national team after last playing for them in March 2022.

He is just nine matches away from reaching a century of appearances for the national team, with France facing six more matches in their bid for World Cup qualification, starting at the beginning of September before bringing their campaign to a close at Azerbaijan in mid-November.

headline: Man United hero follows in Wayne Rooney's footsteps as new job confirmed
body: Ex-Manchester United midfielder Tom Cleverley has been appointed as the new Plymouth Argyle head coach.

The 35-year-old, who retired from professional football in July 2023 as a result of injuries, stepped into coaching at Watford before he was appointed as their head coach in March 2024. However, Cleverley was sacked in May after guiding them to a 14th-place finish. Watford were, at one point, in play-off contention but faded during the second half of the season.
Since, Cleverley has been out of work and searching for his next managerial role. Now, Plymouth have decided to appoint the ex-United man after Miron Muslic's departure.

Despite committing his long-term future to Plymouth at the start of last month, Muslic then opted to leave after receiving an offer from 2. Bundesliga side Schalke. Plymouth have acted fast to source Cleverley as a replacement, with the former Everton man signing a three-year contract at Home Park.

Chairman Simon Hallett cut a delighted figure after confirming the appointment of Cleverley. He told the club's website: "Ever since Miron's departure - and knowing Tom was available - we identified him straightaway as the perfect person to be our next head coach and targeted him immediately.

"When we spoke with him he was completely aligned with the vision and ambitions of the club and it was clear throughout that Tom was the right fit for us. He is fully invested in our long-term plans and will play a key role in helping us achieve them.
"He is young, passionate and did a great job at Watford.
"We are thrilled to bring him to Argyle and look forward to seeing the impact he has on the talented squad at his disposal."

Argyle CEO Andrew Parkinson said: "We were inundated with interest from prospective candidates, which shows how exciting this project is. But, throughout the process, it was clear that Tom was the perfect person to take the club forward.

He's been highly sought after, so we are really pleased we have been able to bring him to Argyle and look forward to seeing him build a squad and style of play that will see us challenging at the top end of League One this season."

Cleverley becomes Plymouth's first head coach within the space of 18 months, with the merry-go-round starting when Steven Schumacher left to join Stoke City in December 2023. Ian Foster was appointed in January 2024 but lasted just 14 matches - with then-director of football Neil Dewsnip and first-team coach Kevin Nancekivell taking over and keeping Argyle in the Championship.
Wayne Rooney, a former teammate of Cleverley's for United and England, then became Argyle's head coach last summer, but was sacked on New Year's Eve after a difficult start to the campaign.
Muslic was brought in to replace Rooney but, although there were some impressive results and performances, he couldn't prevent Plymouth from relegation back to League One.

headline: How to buy new 2025/26 Manchester United Adidas home kit
body: Manchester United have unveiled their new home kit for the 2025/26 and it is available to purchase.
As per United tradition, the new home shirt is predominantly red and the collar and sleeve cuffs are black with a white trim. The shirt also features a V-neck collar.
There is also an abstract sleeve graphic in different shades of red to showcase the various elements of the pitch, stands and tunnel at Old Trafford.
United have also confirmed there is a 'Theatre of Dreams' sign-off on the back of the collar in a nod to Old Trafford. The Snapdragon logo is also the main shirt sponsor once again.
The new home strip is already available to buy online now via the United Store and Fanatics. Prices start at £80 for adults and £60 for juniors.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.

On the design of the new home strip, Senior design director at Adidas, Jurgen Rank, said: "The colour red is fundamental to the club's DNA. There have been many different expressions of it over the years and, for this season, we wanted to do something a little different, using the sleeves as a canvas.
"The abstract graphic stays true to the club's DNA while providing an innovative look and feel to an otherwise classy and classic jersey."
The lightweight shirt features the latest in adidas technology, which United say has been created in close collaboration with the players, throughout the development process.
In addition to the shirt being of traditional United red, the kit launch has revealed the shorts will be white and the socks black. The shorts feature a black trim.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres to Man United transfer latest as Hugo Ekitike bombshell claims emerge
body: Manchester United are caught in the eye of a transfer storm with Sporting CP's Viktor Gyokeres vying for a move to the Premier League, though word has started to emerge of interest in a new striker.

Managed by Ruben Amorim at the Estadio Jose Alvalade over the course of 2023/24 plus the first months of last season, 27-year-old Gyokeres scored 66 of his 97 goals for Sporting. It is that contribution towards the winning of three trophies that have elevated his status as an elite striker, all building up to the current summer transfer window.

Man United, having wrapped up top No.10 target Matheus Cunha's arrival, have turned their attention towards adding a confident goalscorer to their ranks and even without Champions League football to offer, have been linked with making a daring move for Gyokeres.
However, such a plan could quickly come undone based on the latest word out of Portugal.
Mais Futebol have provided the bombshell claim that Premier League rivals Arsenal have now submitted an offer for the Sweden international.

It is said to be a guaranteed sum below €60m (£51m) with bonuses that will take the overall agreement higher. This is far below the €80m (£68.1m) the Portuguese champions are reportedly holding out for.

Such a development would truly be astonishing as sister site football.london had gathered intel that it was RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko, 21, that the North London club were making progress towards signing have elected he to be the top target having initially done homework on the terms for both he and Gyokeres' deals.
The Frenchman, 22, scored 22 goals for the Bundesliga side last season and has already been tied to both Liverpool and Chelsea in rumours
He says Old Trafford chiefs have established contact in the last 48 hours to gather the necessary information about a former Paris Saint-Germain player tipped to move for €100m (£85m).

There had also been warning that the Gunners were making their advance ahead of Man United had been floated when CNN Portugal, via The Mirror, had reported that the player's agent, Hasan Cetinkaya, had met with officials from the Emirates Stadium last night.
The whole situation had taken a turn before that once it began to be reported that Sporting were in fact holding out for an €80m (£68.1m) fee.

Gyokeres was said to be 'furious' with the stance of his club as for a long time, even dating back to the winter, it was suggested the Swede had a 'gentleman's agreement' in place that would mean they would lower the asking price to €69m (£59m) and not block his exit path were a suitable suitor to emerge.

If Arsenal - with the ability to offer a stronger shot at the Premier League title at present plus Champions League football - are advancing, it is all bad news for Man United, who have already lost out on top target Liam Delap to Chelsea.

headline: Tottenham appoint former Man United man as huge new announcement made
body: Tottenham Hotspur have confirmed that former Manchester United coach Andreas Georgson has joined Thomas Frank's backroom staff at Spurs.

The Swede is a set-piece coach who has worked with Frank previously before moving on to Arsenal and then the Reds. Georgson joined United in July and was retained by Ruben Amorim following the dismissal of Erik ten Hag in October.
And Georgson will now reunite with Frank in north London after the former Brentford boss was confirmed as Ange Postecoglou's successor at Tottenham on Thursday evening.
"We are delighted to announce the appointment of Thomas Frank as our new Head Coach on a contract that runs until 2028," Spurs' statement confirming the news read.
"Thomas has extensive experience in English football having joined Brentford in 2016 - since becoming one of the longest-serving current managers in the Premier League.

"During his time at Brentford he transformed the club, moving them up from the Championship to an established Premier League side, consistently and significantly outperforming expectations for an extended period of time.

"In Thomas we are appointing one of the most progressive and innovative head coaches within the game. He has a proven track record in player and squad development and we look forward to him leading the team as we prepare for the season ahead.

"Thomas will be joined from Brentford by Justin Cochrane (First Team Assistant Coach), Chris Haslam (Head of Performance & First Team Assistant Coach) and Joe Newton (First Team Coach Analyst), with Andreas Georgson (First Team Assistant Coach) arriving from Manchester United."

headline: Viktor Gyokeres breaks silence amid Man United transfer twist and Sporting fury - 'I will speak'
body: Manchester United-linked Viktor Gyokeres has broken his silence on social media as speculation surrounding his future at Sporting intensifies.

Gyokeres has emerged as one of Europe's finest No. 9s in recent seasons with a staggering 97 goals in 102 matches since his move from Coventry City to Liga Portugal in July 2023. The forward scored 39 of those goals in the league this season, to help Sporting win the league and cup double.
The 27-year-old reportedly has a gentleman's agreement to leave Sporting this summer for offers above £58 million (€70m) despite a release clause of around £84m (€100m).
However, club president Frederico Varandas revealed on Wednesday that no promises were made to Gyokeres about letting him leave for a cheaper deal this summer.
And Gyokeres has since issued an update on social media. "There is a lot of talk at the moment, most of it is false," he said on Instagram stories. "I will speak when the time is right."
It is unclear whether missing out on Delap will lead United to turn towards Gyokeres instead, amid reports in Portugal on Thursday that Arsenal have submitted a bid for the Swedish star.

Portuguese publication Maisfutebol claim that the Gunners are willing to pay a fixed amount below €60m (around £51m) plus bonuses. It is claimed that despite the initial impasse, negotiations between both clubs are expected to continue in the coming days.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres 'move' made after Man United transfer 'approach' as response given
body: Arsenal have reportedly made a formal offer for Manchester United-linked Viktor Gyokeres.

The Swedish international has risen to prominence as one of Europe's leading strikers in recent years, boasting an impressive tally of 97 goals in 102 matches since his move from Coventry City to Liga Portugal in July 2023.

Sporting's top goal scorer this season has made a significant impact in the Portuguese top-tier, netting 39 goals and providing eight assists in 33 appearances. The 27-year-old has been a pivotal player in Rui Borges' squad, driving Sporting to another league title and cup victory.
Gyokeres reportedly has a gentleman's agreement to leave Sporting this summer for offers above £58million (€70m) despite a release clause of around £84m (€100m).

And Portuguese publication Maisfutebol claim that Arsenal are willing to pay a fixed amount below €60m (around £51m) plus bonuses. It is claimed that despite the initial impasse, negotiations between both clubs are expected to continue in the coming days.
It is also said that United are ready to make a similar offer for the player Amorim knows well from their time at Sporting together.
The reports come after Sporting president Frederico Varandas revealed no promises were made to Gyokeres about letting him leave for €60m this summer.
"It was agreed that Sporting would not demand the release clause at the end of the season, especially because he was going to be 27," Varandas said.
"We knew about Viktor's dream of going to a club where he could fight for the Champions League and we have common sense.
"We guaranteed that we would not demand €100m. Sporting has common sense, it keeps its word.

"The president of Sporting said that the club would not demand the clause and that we would adjust the value to Viktor's performance, he was one of the best players ever to step on the pitch in Portugal."

headline: Mason Mount sends perfect two-word message as Man United transfer completed
body: Mason Mount has taken to social media to wish Matheus Cunha well after he completed a move to Manchester United.
Just days after the Premier League season finished, United moved quickly to sign the Brazilian from Wolverhampton Wanderers by triggering the £62.5m release clause in his contract.
The 26-year-old was one of the standout performers this season, scoring 15 goals and providing six assists to help the Midlands outfit to a 16th-place finish in the Premier League.
On Thursday afternoon, United confirmed that all the paperwork for the deal had been completed and the forward had penned a five-year deal at Old Trafford.
Shortly after that announcement, Mount, who made the move to United from Chelsea two years ago, shared a snap of Cunha signing his contract on Instagram with the caption: "Welcome brother!"

Speaking as a Man United player for the first time, Cunha said: "It is hard to put into words my feelings about becoming a Manchester United player. Ever since I was a child in Brazil watching Premier League games on TV at my grandmother’s house, United was my favourite English team and I dreamed of wearing the red shirt.
"I want to thank my family and everyone who has helped me make that dream a reality.

“I can’t wait for the start of pre-season to get to know my team-mates and prepare for the season ahead. All my focus is now on working hard to become a valuable part of the team, and helping get this club back to the top.”
United's director of football, Jason Wilcox, added: “Bringing in Matheus was one of our main priorities for this summer, so we are delighted to have completed his signing so early in the window.

"He has proved his ability to succeed in the Premier League as one of the most exciting and productive forwards in England during his time at Wolves, and, before that, in Spain and Germany. He has all the qualities we are looking for as we seek to build a strong, dynamic and entertaining team capable of challenging for the biggest honours.”

headline: Manchester United can repeat Ayden Heaven and Chido Obi trick with latest signing
body: Manchester United are closing in on the signing of highly-rated Southampton youngster Harley Emsden-James to continue a recent transfer trend.

The 16-year-old centre-back is poised to make the switch to Old Trafford this summer after the two clubs agreed a compensation package. A report by the Daily Echo has claimed the fee will be a 'minimum of £1million'.
It is understood Jason Wilcox - United's director of football - played a key role in getting the deal in place. Wilcox worked at St Mary's before moving to Old Trafford last year.

United have developed a habit for signing some of the country's hottest prospects since Ineos took control of football operations last year, with the club's recruitment strategy improving for the better under their stewardship.
Hungry to sign young players with potential before they have announced themselves to the wider world, United are attempting to swoop for young talent in low-risk, high-reward deals.
The Reds did that on at least three occasions during the 2024/25 campaign, signing midfielder Sekou Kone from Malian club Guidars FC before swooping for Arsenal duo Chido Obi and Ayden Heaven.

Obi and Heaven have already made their first-team debuts at Old Trafford and the latter is already in the conversation to be a regular starter at centre-back next season. Obi will also be keen for more opportunities after impressing in a handful of cameo outings and scoring twice against Hong Kong on the post-season tour.
Obi joined United after he turned down the offer of a new deal at Arsenal and he signed his first professional contract at Old Trafford after celebrating his 17th birthday in November.
Heaven was signed for a minimal fee in the January transfer window and was considered as a first-team signing despite only making one senior appearance during his time at Arsenal.

United have high hopes for both of them and they will each for pushing for an increase in first-team minutes in 2025/26. If they are successful in their efforts, United's low-risk, high-reward transfer strategy will be fully vindicated.

headline: Transfer rumour power ranking: Arsenal blow, Spurs to beat Man Utd to Mbeumo?
body: Arsenal are finally set to make a decisive move for a striker, while Bryan Mbeumo is reconsidering his previous Spurs stance…
With so much transfer talk doing the rounds, we’re here through the summer to sift through the bullsh*t and highlight the whispers that might have some substance.
Each day we’re ranking the top 20 rumours involving Premier League clubs, the higher the link, the more likely we feel they are to becoming done deals.
So we start with the tittle-tattle…

20) 🆕 Nico Williams – Athletic Bilbao to Arsenal
Arsenal’s interest is real, but Barcelona are being more decisive after Joan Laporta said they had moved on to other targets. His pants are currently on fire.

19) 🆕 Bradley Barcola – PSG to Liverpool
Since Newcastle are selfishly refusing to sell them Alexander Isak, the PSG forward is said to be next on the Reds’ list.  Bayern Munich are also keen on Barcola.

17) Victor Osimhen – Napoli to Manchester United
Osimhen apparently fancies a move to Old Trafford, presumably because he’s seen the salaries United have been dishing out in recent years. Napoli want around £70million, though they may take Joshua Zirkzee in part-exchange. This one doesn’t pass the sniff test, unless we get to late in the window with all parties in the same position they are now.

MORE ON THE SUMMER 2025 TRANSFER WINDOW
👉 Every Premier League transfer and release confirmed in the summer of 2025
👉 Twenty biggest transfers in the world in 2025 summer transfer window
👉 Wirtz next? The last five times every Premier League club broke transfer record

15) 🆕 Jarell Quansah – Liverpool to Bayer Leverkusen
Now Liverpool and Leverkusen appear to have agreed their primary business, they can get to Quansah’s future, with the German’s said to be considering the centre-back as a replacement for Jonathan Tah.

14) James Trafford – Burnley to Newcastle
Word is that Newcastle and Burnley are haggling over the price of a deal that Eddie Howe wanted to do a year ago, with the intention of Trafford and Nick Pope slugging it out for the No.1 spot. Which rarely ever works. Or at least that’s what Howe might tell Pope, but if this comes off, the current Toon keeper’s days are numbered. So Pope might be happy to hear that the two clubs are some way off an agreement with Burnley said to be asking for £40million.

13) 🆕 Oleksandr Zinchenko – Arsenal to AC Milan
Zinchenko has been surplus to requirements for some time and with a year remaining on his contract, Arsenal are motivated to sell. One problem: his fat salary is too rich for Milan’s taste. If they can overcome that obstacle, this definitely fits.

12) Antoine Semenyo – Bournemouth to Tottenham Hotspur
The Cherries reportedly want £70m, which feels unrealistic. A transfer still feels inevitable and Man United, Liverpool and Spurs have all been linked and Londoners are the favourites.

11) 🔼 Luis Diaz – Liverpool to Barcelona
Our reading on this: Barca want Diaz, who would be happy to move to the Nou Camp. Liverpool might be interested in a deal, but only on their terms. Which Barca won’t meet, and Diaz knows it so he won’t kick up a fuss – yet. If this is going to happen, someone needs to change tack. There is plenty of noise coming from Barca but nothing Liverpool can take to the bank.
MORE: Top 10 wingers available this summer features Arsenal, Liverpool targets and Man Utd outcast

10) 🆕 Bryan Mbeumo – Brentford to Tottenham
All Spurs had to do to pique Mbeumo’s intrigue was sack the manager and appoint the Cameroonian’s old one. Thomas Frank’s appointment has, apparently, opened Mbeumo’s mind to the possibility of joining Tottenham. But he did seem pretty determined to joint the Man Utd circus…

9) 🔽 Bryan Mbeumo – Brentford to Manchester United
Mbeumo is giving mixed signals. At first he only had eyes for United but Thomas Frank’s appointment has given Spurs renewed hope. If nothing else, it should prompt United into decisive action in the form of a second offer.

8) 🆕 Darwin Nunez – Liverpool to Napoli
The rumours around Saudi interest remain but Napoli are now eyeing the Kop’s Captain Chaos. Will they pay the £60million-plus Liverpool apparently want? Only if they’re still p*ssed from their title celebrations. Saudi still seems the Reds’ best hope of recouping as much of their £85million outlay as possible, but Nunez will have a say. Ambition, or his very own Scrooge McDuck money pit?

7) Viktor Gyokeres – Sporting to Manchester United
With Arsenal going cold on Gyokeres, there were plenty of reports that the Swede is open to a move to Old Trafford after all. Sporting say they haven’t received any offers and they also insist that reports of a gentleman’s agreement for him to leave for £59million are b*llocks. Which Gyokeres disputes. This could get messy.

6) 🔼 Benjamin Sesko – RB Leipzig to Arsenal
Arsenal, apparently, have come around to RB Leipzig’s thinking and will spend the weekend gathering their loose change with the intention of submitting a serious bid next week.

5) Jamie Gittens – Borussia Dortmund to Chelsea
Chelsea’s improved offer has been swiftly rejected. But a third is expected despite the distraction of the Club World Cup for Chelsea and Dortmund. Gittens is keeping his phone on.

4) Martin Zubimendi – Real Sociedad to Arsenal
This one got the ‘Here we go’ treatment over a month ago but then it all went a bit quiet. And then there was talk of Real Madrid sticking their nose in. Fear not, though, Gooners. Ornstein says it’s done.

3) Milos Kerkez – Bournemouth to Liverpool
Word last week was it’s happening. For around £40million. Which represents decent business for both sides. Things have gone a little quiet since while Liverpool pursue Wirtz but seemingly there is nothing or Reds to worry about here.

2) 🔼 Sverre Nypan – Rosenborg to Manchester City
Arsenal fancied their chances of landing the Norwegian wonderkid, and Villa were in talks in recent months. But City are in the mood for signings and it looks like they have agreed a £12.5million deal for the 18-year-old attacking midfielder.

1) 🔼 Florian Wirtz – Bayer Leverkusen to Liverpool
Liverpool will reportedly pay a British record £116.9m for Wirtz. That’s a lot of wonga. Is Rayan Cherki for a quarter of the price the better transfer?
👉 Five reasons why Florian Wirtz may not actually be a good signing for Liverpool

headline: Spurs ‘launch £70m hijack’ for Man Utd target with Ratcliffe ‘unlikely’ to match Levy ‘offer’
body: Tottenham Hotspur have submitted a £70million bid to hijack Manchester United’s move for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo, according to reports.
Mbeumo scored 20 Premier League goals last season – a tally bettered only by Mohamed Salah, Alexander Isak and Erling Haaland – and also contributed seven assists.
The Cameroonian international has just one year left on his contract, although Brentford hold the option of a further year.

The Bees are said to have accepted that the 25-year-old is ready to move on after another standout campaign and are holding firm on their £70million valuation – which Thomas Frank’s side have now matched.
Tottenham’s offer is worth £65million up front, with a further £5million in add-ons – £10million more than Manchester United’s most recent bid, according to the Mirror.

The report says new Spurs boss Frank is keen to bring Mbeumo to north London after working with the forward at Brentford since 2019 and that the club have ‘launched a £70m bid to hijack United’s move’.
Chairman Daniel Levy views Mbeumo as a statement signing for Frank’s first summer in charge following Ange Postecoglou’s departure.
United, however, remain the forward’s preferred destination despite Tottenham’s higher bid and promise of Champions League football.
Brentford have already rejected two bids from United, the latest worth £60million in total, leaving the door open for Spurs to swoop in with an improved offer – which they have now done.
While United are unlikely to go higher than their current bid, they could still hold an advantage in terms of wages.
It’s reported Mbeumo has been offered between £150,000 and £175,000-a-week at Old Trafford, with bonuses pushing that figure to £200,000.
Spurs’ wage structure would see him earn closer to £130,000–£140,000-a-week, with incentives still falling short of the Red Devils’ total package.

While Spurs have made the most decisive move so far, United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe could yet respond as they weigh up how much more they are willing to spend following the £63million signing of Matheus Cunha from Wolves.
Cunha was officially confirmed as a Red Devils player on Thursday.
The 26-year-old Brazilian said after completing the transfer: “It is hard to put into words my feelings about becoming a Manchester United player.
“Ever since I was a child in Brazil watching Premier League games on TV at my grandmother’s house, United was my favourite English team and I dreamed of wearing the red shirt.
“I want to thank my family and everyone who has helped me make that dream a reality.

“I can’t wait for the start of pre-season to get to know my team-mates and prepare for the season ahead. All my focus is now on working hard to become a valuable part of the team, and helping get this club back to the top.”

headline: Where Gyokeres ‘thinks he will play next season’ after Arsenal bid and Man Utd interest
body: Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres has decided where he ‘thinks’ that he will be playing his football next season amid interest from Arsenal and Man Utd.
It was thought that Gyokeres would not entertain the idea of leaving Sporting for Man Utd in the summer after Ruben Amorim’s side failed to qualify for the Champions League.
But journalist Ben Jacobs revealed that the Sweden international would actually be “very keen” on a move to Old Trafford, regardless of them not being in Europe next term.
Before transfer expert Fabrizio Romano gave an update on Tuesday and claimed that Man Utd “called again” about Gyokeres as they keep “informed” on his situation.

Romano said on his YouTube channel: “From what I heard, last week Man Utd had new contacts with Viktor Gyokeres’ camp, to be informed on the situation, something like ‘okay, if Arsenal are not doing the deal we are still there, we are still interested’.

“Then for Man Utd we have to see financially how they can make it happen, because with Champions League football I’m 99 per cent convinced that they were going to close the Gyokeres deal quite quick. That was the feeling.
READ: Tired of England and ‘awful’ Palmer with ITV yet to explain their ‘blatantly stupid choice’
“Then no Champions League football, they lost the [Europa League] final in Bilbao, and so it’s more complicated financially.
“But for Gyokeres, Man Utd called again. Let’s see if they’re able to make it happen but there were new contacts with the agent of the player.”
Portuguese outlet Maisfutebol revealed earlier today that Arsenal ‘are already preparing a second offer’ for Gyokeres after their first one was dismissed by Sporting.
And now TBR Football has claimed that they know where Gyokeres ‘thinks he’ll be playing next season’ amid interest from Arsenal and Premier League rivals Man Utd.

The Sweden international ‘believes he will be playing in the Premier League next season’ and the striker ‘has made it clear to Sporting in recent months his intention to move and England is his likely destination, although there has been interest from Germany, Italy and Spain’.

TBR Football chief correspondent Graeme Bailey said: “Speaking to sources, Gyokeres is convinced that he is moving this summer and he believes he will be in England – not that he has ruled out other countries, it is just where he believes he will be playing.
“He did make it clear from the start that a deal with Saudi Arabia’s Pro League was not a consideration despite them making an approach this month.
“Arsenal and Man United are in constant contact, the lines of communication with those two clubs has been ongoing for months.

“The player’s representatives are working hard on his future, but there is no deadline here – it could be this month, but likely July I am told before something is agreed, but there is no panic. They are calm.”

headline: Spurs ‘sue’ Man Utd owners Ineos, Ratcliffe over ‘multi-million pound partnership’ row
body: Tottenham Hotspur have launched legal proceedings against Ineos Automotive, a subsidiary of the multinational owned by Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe, over the early termination of a commercial partnership.

This is according to a report from The Telegraph, which says the dispute – listed under “general commercial contracts and arrangements” – concerns a multi-million pound five-year deal agreed in December 2022, which named Ineos Grenadier as Spurs’ “official 4×4 vehicle partner”.
Ineos informed the club last December that it was exercising a contractual right to end the agreement two years early, and talks over a resolution have since failed.
The High Court claim was formally lodged on 12 June – less than a month after Spurs beat Manchester United, part-owned by Ineos, in the Europa League final.
Tottenham and Ineos have worked together since 2020, beginning with a pandemic-era deal for the petrochemicals giant to supply hand sanitiser.

Ineos has been scaling back its sporting investments in recent months, also cutting ties with the All Blacks and Sir Ben Ainslie’s sailing team. New Zealand Rugby had also pursued legal action over an early exit from a six-year sponsorship deal, though that dispute has since been resolved.
MORE: Transfer rumour power ranking: Man Utd to rival Liverpool, Chelsea; new Nunez link
The company has cited mounting financial pressures – including high energy prices and European carbon taxes – as the reason for its strategic cutbacks.
Ratcliffe, who acquired a 27.7% stake in Manchester United in December 2023, has also overseen cost-cutting measures at Old Trafford, including job losses and ticket price increases.

A spokesperson for Ineos told The Telegraph: “It’s completely normal for partnerships to be reviewed on a regular basis, and we’ve decided that the partnership wasn’t working out for us. We have the right to terminate the partnership.”
Spurs have yet to comment publicly on the legal action.

Upon announcing the Grenadier deal in 2022, Daniel Levy’s side said: “Our partnership with Ineos Grenadier represents the coming together of an innovative British brand with an iconic London football club – both of whom are committed to pushing boundaries and daring to do things differently, while staying true to authentic values and traditions.”
Meanwhile, Ineos told Telegraph Sport that it had exercised “a contractual right to terminate” its partnership with Tottenham last December.
A spokesperson said: “Ineos Automotive has been a partner of Tottenham Hotspur since 2022, taking on a partnership agreement that Ineos Group had in place with the club since 2020.
“Like any business, we have to be diligent in how we operate and where we invest marketing budgets.
“It’s completely normal for partnerships to be reviewed on a regular basis, and we’ve decided that the partnership wasn’t working out for us. We have the right to terminate the partnership.”

headline: Man Utd ‘resume talks’ to seal £64m Osimhen swoop but have ‘not given up on’ Gyokeres
body: Man Utd have ‘resumed talks’ over a potential move for Napoli striker Victor Osimhen but Viktor Gyokeres is also still in the frame, according to reports.
The Red Devils are still recovering from a dreadful season under Ruben Amorim after the Portuguese head coach failed to improve on Erik ten Hag’s poor start to the campaign.
Amorim’s side will go down as the worst Man Utd team to have played in the Premier League with his 15th-placed outfit winning just 11 matches in 38 this term.
They also blew their ticket to Champions League qualification, which would have boosted their transfer budget, by losing 1-0 to Tottenham in the Europa League final last month.
Man Utd particularly struggled with scoring goals in the Premier League as Zirkzee and fellow striker Rasmus Hojlund came in for lots of criticism.
The strike duo only scored seven Premier League goals between them, although Zirkzee missed the final couple of months through injury.
READ: Transfer rumour power ranking: Man Utd to rival Liverpool, Chelsea; new Nunez link
Only four Premier League sides scored fewer goals than Man Utd in the 2024/25 campaign and now INEOS’ initial focus in the transfer market is improving their attack.
Matheus Cunha has already arrived at Old Trafford from Wolves in deal worth £62.5m, while Man Utd have also had a bid rejected for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo.
Man City academy product Liam Delap had reportedly been their top centre-forward target before Chelsea beat them to the Ipswich Town striker’s signature.
There have also been rumours that Man Utd have made contact with Sporting CP over a potential move for Gyokeres with Arsenal also in the running for the striker.

But now French website Foot Mercato insist that Osimhen is emerging as an option again for Man Utd with the Nigeria international ‘looking for a new club’ still after he ‘failed to reach an agreement’ with Saudi Arabian side Al-Hilal, despite a ‘lavish offer’.
Turkish giants Galatasaray, where he spent last season on loan from Napoli, ‘still hopes to keep him’ but the 26-year-old ‘has resumed talks with’ Premier League side Man Utd.
The striker ‘had discussed with Manchester United at the beginning of May the conditions of a possible arrival at Old Trafford’.

And now ‘talks have resumed very recently under the conditions discussed a few weeks ago, namely a salary of €12 million for the player and compensation of €75 million including bonuses for Napoli, the club that owns the player’.
READ NEXT: Five Brentford stars reassigned to PL rivals amid Frank to Tottenham as Man Utd, Arsenal benefit
According to reports, Liverpool have held a ‘private’ meeting’ over signing a £63m striker, who has a ‘most likely destination’ this summer.
Man Utd are prepared to use Joshua Zirkzee in a swap deal to sign Victor Osimhen from Napoli in the summer transfer window, according to reports.
Victor Osimhen has rejected Saudi Arabian side Al Hilal, despite a €75million (£63.2m) package being agreed with Napoli, according to reports.
Saudi Arabian side Al Hilal have submitted an official offer to Napoli for striker Victor Osimhen, according to Fabrizio Romano.
Man Utd captain Bruno Fernandes holds the key to the Red Devils’ potential efforts to sign Victor Osimhen in the summer, according to reports.
It all felt a bit Liam Delap or bust for Man Utd, but they’re back to the drawing board and we’ve struggled to come up with these seven striker options.

headline: Tottenham ‘receive encouragement’ over Man Utd hijack with Mbeumo now ‘more intrigued’
body: Tottenham have ‘received encouragement’ over a possible transfer for Man Utd target Bryan Mbeumo after ‘initial discussions with Brentford’.
Man Utd are looking to sign another new forward after unveiling Matheus Cunha as a new signing at Old Trafford on Thursday.
Mbeumo has been the subject of interest from the Red Devils for a long time with journalist Ben Jacobs revealing yesterday that Ruben Amorim’s side are set to make a second formal bid “imminently”.
Jacobs told The United Stand: “There hasn’t been a formal second bid placed yet. But what is happening, is there are conversations around a new number, much closer to the Matheus Cunha valuation.

“And when Manchester United feel that not just that number, but the structure is competitive based on their feedback from Brentford – and all of those discussions are ongoing at the moment – the expectation, and quite imminently, is they will then put that formal second bid in with a higher percentage chance.
“Hopefully from Manchester United’s point of view, that will be accepted.”
READ: Transfer rumour power ranking: Man Utd to rival Liverpool, Chelsea; new Nunez link

‘Mbeumo is understood to be more intrigued by a move to Tottenham now that Thomas Frank has become their head coach. And Spurs have received encouragement about a potential deal now that the Dane has made the switch to North London.
‘Last week we reported Spurs had stepped up their interest in Semenyo prior to sacking Ange Postecoglou. Manchester United had a bid rejected for Mbeumo before Spurs started talks to hire Frank.

‘And we reported last week that United are expected to make another offer for the Cameroon star. United are also interested in Semenyo too.’
And former Man Utd chief scout Mick Brown – who is still well-connected in the Premier League – reckons Frank ‘could be a big pull for Mbeumo’ this summer.

Brown told Football Insider: “It’s going to be difficult to beat Man United to Mbeumo. United are well down the line on this move, and the player himself wishes to make that move to Old Trafford rather than other potential clubs.
“Thomas Frank could be a big pull for Mbeumo, but United are very optimistic that they’ll be able to land the Cameroon international.
“They’ve had one bid rejected and talks are ongoing with Brentford. They just need to reach a compromise over his fee and then that deal will get done.

“The other factor is that Spurs won’t be able to match United on wages they could offer. So Man United are still in the driving seat to get this done, despite suggestions that Tottenham could hijack their move.”

headline: Man City leapfrog Chelsea in biggest summer spenders list but quadruple splurge still cheaper than Wirtz
body: Chelsea are bidding to be the world’s biggest spenders in the summer window for the fourth consecutive season, but Manchester City have overtaken them.
All fees and figures are taken from Transfermarkt. The 20 biggest deals of the summer are here.

10) Liverpool – £33.7m
They idle down on the list after the signing of Jeremie Frimpong and a new third-choice goalkeeper, but they will catapult to the top if they pull off the British record transfer of Florian Wirtz.

9) Burnley – £35.22m
Last season’s loans have been made permanent, with Bashir Humphreys the most expensive of the quartet. Now to persuade somebody not already in Burnley to sign for Burnley…

8) West Ham – £35.4m
Penny for the thoughts of Graham Potter, who inherited the ‘loan with obligation to buy’ deal that is Jean-Clair Todibo.
CHECK OUT: The F365 transfer rumour power ranking

7) Brighton – £41.5m
Perhaps in an effort to ensure Fabian Hurzeler has enough of an age gap over at least some of his squad, Brighton have spent a fair whack on three exciting teenagers from Sunderland, Daejeon Hana Citizen and Olympiacos.

6) Borussia Dortmund – £52.48m
They used the Club World Cup transfer window to bring in Jobe Bellingham and Yan Couto and they could add Jason Sancho.

5) Real Madrid – £58.5m
They have dropped £50m on Dean Huijsen and £8.5m on a few weeks of Trent Alexander-Arnold. Welcome to the big time, Xabi Alonso.

4) Juventus – £62.27m
Every penny has so far been spent on making loan signings permanent, with Nico Gonzalez their most expensive purchase.

3) Manchester United – £62.5m
They have completed the most expensive transfer of the summer so far with the capture of Wolves maverick Matheus Cunha, with Bryan Mbeumo likely to follow. We’re not sure where all this money is coming from…

2) Chelsea – £102.6m
They were the top spenders in the summers of 2024, 2023 and 2022 and will be up there in 2025 thanks to pre-arranged moves for Estevao, Dario Essugo, Mamadou Sarr and Kendry Paez. Throw in the £30m signing of Liam Delap and the Blues are already making very expensive waves.

1) Manchester City – £109.6m
That’s the price of a Rayan Ait-Nouri from Wolves, a Rayan Cherki from Lyon and a Tijanji Reijnders from AC Milan, and all of them feel like bargains. Pep Guardiola wanted Florian Wirtz but he will cost more on his own.

headline: Arsenal prepare second bid to ‘exceed’ £60m for Gyokeres; Man Utd set to respond with ‘official offer’
body: Arsenal are preparing to make a second bid for Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres with Man Utd set to respond, according to reports.
The Gunners have already got a deal for Real Sociedad midfielder ‘done and signed’ despite reports that Spanish giants Real Madrid could hijack the transfer.
And their next big transfer targets are reportedly a new centre-forward and winger with Arsenal quite far down the road on a deal for Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko.
But issues over getting the Bundesliga side to drop their asking price with the Slovenian striker reportedly becoming ‘hugely frustrated’ at the situation.
That has seen Arsenal turn towards Gyokeres, according to widespread reports in Portugal, despite the Sporting CP president’s insistence that they won’t sell for €70m this summer.

Updating everyone on Gyokeres’ situation, transfer expert Fabrizio Romano said on his YouTube channel earlier this week: “Gyokeres was and remains an option for Arsenal in terms of new striker. Because at the moment my information is Arsenal are advancing on the deal for Benjamin Sesko.
READ: Transfer rumour power ranking: Liverpool’s Isak alternative, City strike deal to screw Arsenal
“So Sesko is the clear favourite, there are conversations ongoing. But it’s still not a done deal. So until the Sesko deal is a done we have to be careful.

“At the moment Sesko remains the favourite, Viktor Gyokeres remains the other option on the table, but as it’s now two or three weeks that Arsenal are still not advancing on the Gyokeres deal, all the other clubs keep calling his agents.

“That’s what happened in the last 48 hours over the weekend. From what I heard, last week Man Utd had new contacts with Viktor Gyokeres’ camp, to be informed on the situation, something like ‘okay, if Arsenal are not doing the deal we are still there, we are still interested’.

“Then for Man Utd we have to see financially how they can make it happen, because with Champions League football I’m 99 per cent convinced that they were going to close the Gyokeres deal quite quick. That was the feeling.

MORE ON ARSENAL FROM F365…

“Then no Champions League football, they lost the [Europa League] final in Bilbao, and so it’s more complicated financially.
“But for Gyokeres, Man Utd called again. Let’s see if they’re able to make it happen but there were new contacts with the agent of the player.”
After reports that Arsenal have made an opening bid for the Swede, Portuguese outlet Maisfutebol insist that the Gunners ‘are already preparing a second offer’.
It is the Premier League club’s ‘aim is to improve the fixed value of the offer and, with that, exceed the 70 million euros in total deal (fixed value + bonuses for objectives)’.
Their initial showed Arsenal ‘willing to pay a fixed amount below 60 million euros (something around 55 million euros), but which, with bonuses for objectives, could reach close to 65 million euros’.
After the ‘urgent request’ by Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta, it is claimed that ‘there has been growing optimism among the Swedish international’s representatives regarding a positive outcome’.
While Man Utd ‘continue to say that they are ready to make an official offer of 60 million euros fixed, with another 10 million euros for objectives’.

Former Bayern Munich winger Leroy Sane has revealed why he rejected an offer from Arsenal to move to Galatasaray on a free transfer this summer.
Arsenal are reportedly preparing a ‘formal proposal’ for Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres amid issues over a Benjamin Sesko transfer.
Man Utd are set to make a second “formal bid” for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo “imminently” as Viktor Gyokeres pushes for a move, according to reports.
RB Leipzig star Benjamin Sesko has been ‘advised’ to reject one summer transfer amid interest from Premier League giants Arsenal.

headline: Five Brentford stars reassigned to PL rivals amid Frank to Tottenham as Man Utd, Arsenal benefit
body: With Thomas Frank off to Spurs, we have jumped the gun on a possible Brentford exodus and reassigned five Bees stars to rival Premier League clubs…

A move to a Big Six club had been long overdue for perennial overachiever Thomas Frank as he’s made pretty light work of establishing Brentford in the Premier League, with two top-half finishes and three of his four seasons in the division ending without even the slightest fear of relegation.

It’s a phenomenal achievement for a club of Brentford’s size and it’s a credit to them and Frank in particular, that it would feel weird not to have them in the Premier League with their feet firmly under the top-flight table.

Frank’s move to Tottenham for a supposed upward career move could raise their relegation fears, but the ever-increasing gap to the Championship should cushion their likely decline next season as Leeds United and co. face an uphill battle to buck a disheartening trend.

Brentford’s situation would become more problematic if several key stars follow Frank in leaving this summer, though. With that, we have decided to prepare their supporters for this worst-case scenario (you’re welcome, by the way) by reassigning five Bees standouts to rival Premier League clubs…

Kevin Schade to Arsenal
The Gunners have finally pulled their finger out and caught up with the rest of the footballing world, who some time ago that they needed to sign a new, for lack of a better term, proper striker.
RB Leipzig’s Benjamin Sesko looks to be their man as they are in deep negotiations with the Bundesliga side, while they are also searching the market for a new left winger.

Bukayo Saka has emphatically left Gabriel Martinelli in the dirt, with their respective development heading in opposite directions as the stagnated Brazil international’s uninspiring form has fuelled their interest in potential upgrades, including one ‘dream target’.

With a large chunk of Arsenal’s summer budget likely to be spent on a striker, they may not have the financial muscle to splash out on a direct upgrade on Martinelli and if they decide to pursue an affordable option to compete with, rather than replace, the Gunners star, Schade would not be a bad shout.

The 23-year-old, valued at £25m on transfermarkt amid reported interest from Borussia Dortmund, enjoyed a breakout season in 2024/25 and was a consistent provider of goal involvements, with his final total of 13 in 38 games a more-than-respectable tally.
Rodrygo or Nico Williams would be ideal statement signings for Arsenal to send a message, but the addition of Schade could be enough to give Martinelli a much-needed kick up the arse.
READ: Thomas Frank sack incoming as Spurs and football are stupid, mate

Bryan Mbeumo to Manchester United
Man Utd are already doing some good business in this summer’s transfer market, which is especially impressive considering they apparently faced going “bust by Christmas”.
Co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe and his ever-changing recruitment team have prioritised fixing a key problem area after there was a severe lack of goals in Ruben Amorim’s side last season.

It has not helped that the squad inherited by Amorim was not suited to his 3-4-3 system, but their dire Premier League form ensured they were shot of confidence and the lack of creativity in the side was laid bare as they struggled to forge enough openings at goal.

The Red Devils seemingly have two irons in the fire for a new No.9, while significantly more progress has been made in their overhaul of the No.10 department, with £65m-rated Mbeumo set to follow Matheus Cunha in joining United for four reasons.

This is somewhat surprising given how shambolic United were in the 2024/25 season, but the grandeur of the club is  still enough to lure key targets to their “graveyard”. Mbeumo and Cunha are great signings on paper, but we have been here before and success at Old Trafford, even for these seemingly safe bets, is far from a guarantee.
